Celestino is a current PhD student at INDiCASTA-AIP in Cuidad de Saber, Panama. He is co-advised by Luis Fernando DeLeon, Jose Loaiza, and Matt. Celestinoâ€™s dissertation focuses on the application of ultraconserved elements (UCES) to understanding the biogeographic history and species limits in Neotropical birds and fishes.

Celestino is an all-around excellent genetic ornithologist, with extensive experience in field ornithology, specimen preparation, DNA sequencing, NGS library prep, and bioinformatics.
